questions.question_text: Which three are benefits of using RAC One Node in Oracle 19c? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCD
B: True. RAC One Node supports rolling patching, which allows patching with minimal downtime by enabling patches to be applied one node at a time.
C: True, RAC One Node enhances high availability by automatically failing over the database instance to another node in the cluster if the primary node experiences a failure. This failover mechanism ensures that the database remains accessible without manual intervention, thereby reducing downtime.
D: True. RAC One Node allows for an online conversion from non-RAC databases to RAC One Node databases, providing a streamlined upgrade path for adding high availability without downtime.
E: false
Although RAC One Node offers flexibility in terms of converting to and from single-instance and RAC configurations, this option was not selected because the question specifically asks for benefits of using RAC one node.

choices.E: Online conversion from RAC One Node databases to multi-instance RAC databases
choices.A: Multiple instances of the same database on a single node to protect against instance failure
choices.F: Load balancing of services within a single instance
choices.D: Online conversion from non-RAC databases to RAC One Node databases

choices.B: srvctl stop service prevents logins for service HR only to CDB1 on HOST01.
choices.E: srvctl stop service closes PDB_1 on all CDB1 instances.
choices.A: HR is available on a single instance of prod_pool.
choices.C: HR is uniformly managed across all instances in prod_pool.
choices.D: srvctl stop service prevents logins to any instance of CDB1 using service HR.
choices.F: srvctl stop service only closes PDB_1 in the instance on HOST01.

questions.question_text:
You support a three-instance, policy-managed, multitenant RAC database CDB1 with two PDBs PDB_1 and PDB_2.

It runs on an eight-node cluster and serverpool prod_pool has three servers.

Examine these commands executed on HOST01:

//IMG//


Which two statements are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
service is uniform managed by default and stop service doesn't close pdb

questions.question_text:
You plan to use DBCA to convert a single-instance Oracle 19c database on a local filesystem on a stand-alone server to RAC by using ASM.

You installed Grid Infrastructure 19c on a four-node cluster.

Examine this list of possible conversion steps:

1. Create a template and image files from the single-instance database by using DBCA.
2. Perform an RMAN backup of the single-instance database.
3. Validate the cluster using CLUVFY.
4. Copy the template and image files to a cluster node.
5. Restore the RMAN backup to the recovery area disk group on the cluster.
6. Perform an Oracle Database 19c RAC software installation.
7. Create a RAC database with DBCA using the RMAN backup.
8. Create a RAC database with DBCA using the template.

Which option correctly lists the correct sequence of the minimum steps required to perform the conversion?

comments.content: I think D can be a better answer because of "minimum" step. CLUVFY is not mandatory and it is automatically invoked with oui.
